ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:0.5_0: 3. The third training rule on the robe-making season
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.2_0: At that time a monk had been given robe-cloth outside the robe season.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.3_0: While he was making the robe, he realized there was not enough cloth.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.4_0: Lifting it up, he smoothed it out again and again.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.5_0: While walking about the dwellings, the Buddha saw that monk acting in this way.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.8_0: “Sir, I’ve been given this robe-cloth outside the robe season,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.9_0: if there is not enough cloth when the robe is being made.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.10_0: That’s why I lift it up and smooth it out again and again.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.11_0: “Are you expecting to receive more cloth?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.13_0: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.1.14_0: “Monks, I allow you to receive out-of-season robe-cloth, and then store it out.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.2.1_0: When they knew that the Buddha had given this allowance, some monks kept out-of-season robe-cloth for more than a month,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.2.2_0: in bundles on a bamboo robe-rack.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.2.3_0: While walking about the dwellings, Venerable Ānanda saw that robe-cloth,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.1_0: “It’s our out-of-season robe-cloth, which we’re keeping because we’re expecting more.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.2_0: “How long have you kept this cloth?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.4_0: and Ānanda then complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.5_0: “How can these monks keep out-of-season robe-cloth for more than a month?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.6_0: After rebuking those monks in many ways, Ānanda told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.7_0: “Is it true, monks, that some monks do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.10_0: “... How can these foolish men keep out-of-season robe-cloth for more than a month?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.11_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.12_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.13.1_0: ‘When his robe is finished and the robe-making season has ended, if out-of-season robe-cloth is given to a monk, he may receive it if he wishes.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.14_0: If he receives it, he should quickly make a robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.15_0: If there is not enough cloth, but he is expecting more, he should keep it at most one month to make up the lack.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:1.3.16_0: If he keeps it beyond that, even if he expects more cloth, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.2_0: A monk has made a robe; or the robe-cloth is lost, stolen, or burnt; or his expectation of more robe-cloth is thwarted.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.4_0: The Sangha has finished his meal, on the eighth day of the month, the Sangha becomes clear.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.6_0: if the robe-making procedure has not been done, robe-cloth that is given during the eleven months.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.7_0: if the robe-making procedure has been done,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.8_0: Also, if it is given in the robe season, but the cloth is designated, it is called “out-of-season robe-cloth”.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.10_0: Is given by the Sangha, by a group, by a relative, or by a friend, or there are rags, or it is by means of his own property.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.12_0: if he desires, he may receive it.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.13_0: If he receives it, he should quickly make a robe:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.14_0: it should be made within ten days.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.15_0: If there is not enough cloth:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.16_0: if there is not enough cloth when the robe is being made.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.17_0: He should keep it at most one month:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.18_0: he should keep it for one month at the maximum.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.20_0: for the purpose of making up the lack.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.1.22_0: he is expecting more from the Sangha, from a group, from a relative, or from a friend, or he is expecting to get rags, or he is expecting to get it by means of his own property.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.2_0: If he is given the expected robe-cloth on the same day as he was given the original robe-cloth, it must be made into a robe within ten days.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.3_0: If he is given the expected robe-cloth two days after he was given the original robe-cloth, it must be made into a robe within ten days.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.31_0: If he is given the expected robe-cloth twenty-one days after he was given the original robe-cloth, it should be transferred to another.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.32_0: If he does not determine it, transfer it to another, or give it away, it becomes subject to relinquishment at dawn on the thirty-first day.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.33_0: It should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.34_0: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.36_0: ‘Venerables, this out-of-season robe-cloth that I have kept over seven days is to be relinquished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.37_0: I relinquish them to the Sangha.’ ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.2.40_0: ‘I give these tonics back to you.’”

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np3:2.4.5_0: The third rule, the third training rule on the robe-making season, is finished.
